Package jetbrains.exodus.env

Interface ContextualEnvironment

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, Backupable, java.io.Closeable, Environment
    public interface ContextualEnvironment
extends Environment
    ContextualEnvironment is always aware of transaction started in current thread. Its openStore() methods return ContextualStore instances.
    See Also:
    Environment, ContextualStore

    • Method Detail

      • openBitmap

        @NotNull
@NotNull ContextualBitmap openBitmap​(@NotNull
                                     @NotNull java.lang.String name,
                                     @NotNull
                                     @NotNull StoreConfig config)
        Opens existing or creates new instance of Bitmap. Internally opens existing or creates new store with specific name and config = StoreConfig.WITHOUT_DUPLICATES inside a transaction started in current thread.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of opened store is formed from specified name and suffix "#bitmap".
        Returns:
        Bitmap instance

      • openStore

        @NotNull
@NotNull ContextualStore openStore​(@NotNull
                                   @NotNull java.lang.String name,
                                   @NotNull
                                   @NotNull StoreConfig config)
        Opens existing or creates new store with specified name and config inside transaction started in current thread. Internally, it calls getAndCheckCurrentTransaction() to ensure that transaction started in current thread exists. StoreConfig provides meta-information used to create store. If it is known that the store with specified name exists, then StoreConfig.USE_EXISTING can be used.
        Parameters:
        name - name of store
        config - StoreConfig used to create store
        Returns:
        ContextualStore instance
        See Also:
        ContextualStore, StoreConfig

      • openStore

        @Nullable
@Nullable ContextualStore openStore​(@NotNull
                                    @NotNull java.lang.String name,
                                    @NotNull
                                    @NotNull StoreConfig config,
                                    boolean creationRequired)
        Opens existing or creates new store with specified name and config inside transaction started in current thread. Internally, it calls getAndCheckCurrentTransaction() to ensure that transaction started in current thread exists. StoreConfig provides meta-information used to create store. If it is known that the store with specified name exists, then StoreConfig.USE_EXISTING can be used.

        Pass true as creationRequired if creating new store is required or allowed. In that case, the method will do the same as openStore(String, StoreConfig). If you pass false the method will return null for non-existing store.
        Parameters:
        name - name of store
        config - StoreConfig used to create store
        creationRequired - pass false if you wish to get null for non-existing store rather than create it.
        Returns:
        ContextualStore instance
        See Also:
        ContextualStore, StoreConfig

      • openStore

        @NotNull
@NotNull ContextualStore openStore​(@NotNull
                                   @NotNull java.lang.String name,
                                   @NotNull
                                   @NotNull StoreConfig config,
                                   @NotNull
                                   @NotNull Transaction transaction)
        Description copied from interface: Environment
        Opens existing or creates new store with specified name and config inside a transaction. StoreConfig provides meta-information used to create store. If it is known that the store with specified name exists, then StoreConfig.USE_EXISTING can be used.
        Specified by:
        openStore in interface Environment
        Parameters:
        name - name of store
        config - StoreConfig used to create store
        transaction - Transaction used to create store
        Returns:
        Store instance

      • openStore

        @Nullable
@Nullable ContextualStore openStore​(@NotNull
                                    @NotNull java.lang.String name,
                                    @NotNull
                                    @NotNull StoreConfig config,
                                    @NotNull
                                    @NotNull Transaction transaction,
                                    boolean creationRequired)
        Description copied from interface: Environment
        Opens existing or creates new store with specified name and config inside a transaction. StoreConfig provides meta-information used to create the store. If it is known that the store with specified name exists, then StoreConfig.USE_EXISTING can be used.

        Pass true as creationRequired if creating new store is required or allowed. In that case, the method will do the same as Environment.openStore(String, StoreConfig, Transaction). If you pass false the method will return null for non-existing store.
        Specified by:
        openStore in interface Environment
        Parameters:
        name - name of store
        config - StoreConfig used to create store
        transaction - Transaction used to create store
        creationRequired - pass false if you wish to get null for non-existing store rather than create it
        Returns:
        Store instance

      • getCurrentTransaction

        @Nullable
@Nullable Transaction getCurrentTransaction()
        Returns:
        transaction instance or null if no transaction is started in current thread
        See Also:
        Transaction

      • getAndCheckCurrentTransaction

        @NotNull
@NotNull Transaction getAndCheckCurrentTransaction()
        Returns:
        transaction instance started in current thread
        Throws:
        ExodusException - if there is no transaction started in current thread
        See Also:
        Transaction

      • getAllStoreNames

        @NotNull
@NotNull java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAllStoreNames()
        This method is equivalent to Environment.getAllStoreNames(Transaction): 
             List stores = getAllStoreNames(getAndCheckCurrentTransaction());
        Returns:
        the list of names of all stores created in the environment.
        See Also:
        Environment.getAllStoreNames(Transaction)
